properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 2:04PM EST until February 10 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for Small Streams in...
Northeastern Washington County in southeastern Ohio...

* Until 500 PM EST.

* At 204 PM EST, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicated
an area of light to moderate rain was moving across the warned
area.  This rain coupled with previous rain that occurred
overnight and this morning has caused the Little Muskingum River
to rise. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

At 1230 PM EST, the stage at Bloomfield was 16.27 feet.  The
estimated flood stage is 16 feet.  The river is expected to crest
near 16.5 feet early this afternoon, then start a slow fall later
this afternoon and evening.  At stages near 16 feet, Route 26 near
the intersection with Route 260 starts to flood.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Low and poor drainage areas along and near the Little Muskingum
River.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
